channel.title: Home on Kirsten Gotting

item.title: Research
item.description: Current I am broadly interested in evolutionary genomics, and for my PhD work I have joined Cameron Currie’s lab at the University of Wisconsin - Madison. In the Currie lab, we study how symbiosis shapes biodiversity. Currently, I am working with the fungus farming ant symbiosis to understand the selective forces that shape pathogen resistance in the specialized mycoparasite Escovopsis. Previous Before joining my PhD program at the UW-Madison I worked as a bioinformaticist in Alejandro SÃ¡nchez’s lab at The Stowers Institute for Medical Research.
